action.action-desc: Mr. Rohrabacher (for himself, Mr. Poe of Texas, Mr. King of Iowa, Mr. Bishop of Michigan, Mr. Webster of Florida, and Mr. Grothman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To recognize that Christians and Yazidis in Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, and Libya are targets of genocide, and to provide for the expedited processing of immigrant and refugee visas for such individuals, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Save Christians from Genocide Act.

paragraph.text: recognizes that Christians and Yazidis in Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, and Libya are targets of genocide and encourages other nations to likewise recognize the ongoing genocide and the threat of genocide to these people; and
further recognizes that such targets of genocide who are seeking admission to the United States as immigrants or refugees should be given priority and expedited processing.

section.header: Emergency admission of refugees and immigrants

paragraph.text: The persecution of Christians and Yazidis in Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, and Libya constitutes an unforeseen emergency refugee situation, and the admission of such persecuted individuals in response to that situation is of grave humanitarian concern.

The Secretary of Homeland Security shall provide for the expedited processing of the visas for aliens described in paragraph (3), and shall ensure that such applications receive first priority among applications for refugee status.
An alien is described in this paragraph if the alien—

subparagraph.text: is a citizen or national of Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, or Libya, or in the case of an alien having no nationality, whose country of last habitual residence was Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, or Libya;
is a member of the Christian or Yazidi community; and
is seeking admission to the United States as a refuge under section 207 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1157).

paragraph.text: For purposes of qualifying as a refugee under section 101 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101)—

subparagraph.text: membership in the Christian or Yazidi community shall qualify an alien described in paragraph (3) as a member of a persecuted group; and

the requirement that an alien be outside any country of such person's nationality or, in the case of a person having no nationality, is outside any country in which such person last habitually resided, shall not apply to an alien described in paragraph (3).

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall provide for the expedited processing of visas for the aliens described in paragraph (2), and shall ensure that such applications receive first priority among applications for immigrant status.
An alien is described in this paragraph if the alien—

subparagraph.text: is a citizen or national of Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, Libya, or in the case of an alien having no nationality, whose country of last habitual residence was Iraq, Syria, Pakistan, Iran, or Libya;
is a member of the Christian or Yazidi community; and
is seeking admission to the United States as an immigrant under subsection (a) or (b) of section 203 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1153).
